sentence.value: Alexey Arkhipovich Leonov (Russian: ???????? ?????????? ???????, IPA: [?l???ksej ??rx?ip?v??t? l???on?f]; born 30 May 1934 in Listvyanka, Kemerovo Oblast, Soviet Union) is a retired Soviet/Russian cosmonaut and Air Force Major General who, on 18 March 1965, became the first human to conduct an extra-vehicular activity (EVA), also known as a space walk.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Alexey Arkhipovich Leonov|Alexey_Leonov]] ([[Russian|Russia]]: ???????? ?????????? ???????, IPA: [?l???ksej ??rx?ip?v??t? l???on?f]; born 30 May [[1934|1934]] in [[Listvyanka|Listvyanka,_Tisulsky_District,_Kemerovo_Oblast]], [[Kemerovo Oblast|Kemerovo_Oblast]], [[Soviet Union|Soviet_Union]]) is a retired [[Soviet/Russian|Russian_Soviet_Federative_Socialist_Republic]] [[cosmonaut|Astronaut]] and [[Air Force|Air_force]] [[Major General|Major_general]] who, on 18 March [[1965|1965_(album)]], became the first human to conduct [[an extra-vehicular activity|Extra-vehicular_activity]] ([[EVA|Extra-vehicular_activity]]), also known as [[a space walk|Extra-vehicular_activity]].

sentence.value: Leonov was to have been commander of the 1971 Soyuz 11 mission to Salyut 1, the first manned space station, but his crew was replaced with the backup after the cosmonaut Valery Kubasov was suspected to have contracted tuberculosis.

sentence.value: The next two Salyuts (actually the military Almaz station) were lost at launch or failed soon after, and Leonov's crew stood by.

sentence.value: Leonov's second trip into space was similarly significant: he commanded the Soviet half of the 1975 Apollo-Soyuz mission – Soyuz 19 – the first joint space mission between the Soviet Union and the United States.

sentence.value: Arthur C. Clarke wrote in his notes to 2010: Odyssey Two that, after a 1968 screening of 2001: A Space Odyssey, Leonov pointed out to him that the alignment of the Moon, Earth, and Sun shown in the opening is essentially the same as that in Leonov's 1967 painting Near the Moon, although the painting's diagonal framing of the scene was not replicated in the film.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Arthur C. Clarke|Arthur_C._Clarke]] wrote in [[his notes|Note]] to [[2010|Stargate_SG-1_(season_4)]]: [[Odyssey|2001:_A_Space_Odyssey_(film)]] Two that, after a [[1968|An_American_Carol]] [[screening|Screening]] of [[2001|Stargate_SG-1_(season_5)]]: [[A Space Odyssey|2001:_A_Space_Odyssey]], Leonov pointed out to him that the alignment of [[the Moon|Moon]], [[Earth|Earth]], and Sun shown in the opening is essentially the same as that in Leonov's [[1967|1967]] [[painting|Painting]] Near [[the Moon|Moon]], although the [[painting|Painting]]'s diagonal framing of the scene was not replicated in [[the film|2001:_A_Space_Odyssey_(film)]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Arthur C.
